function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Detection and quantification of SARS-Coronavirus-2 RNA in sewage samples.","Impact":"Failure to accurately detect and quantify SARS-Coronavirus-2 RNA could lead to a misrepresentation of the prevalence of COVID-19 in the population served by the WWTP.","Mitigation":"Regular validation of the detection and quantification methods, including cross-validation with clinical data, and continuous improvement of RNA extraction and quantification techniques.","Technologies":"Quantitative real-time polymerase chain reaction (qPCR) and ultrafiltration for sample concentration.","People":"Researchers, public health officials, and the population served by the WWTP.","Owner":"Researchers, public health authorities, and WWTP operators."},{"Description":"Proxy for the period prevalence of COVID-19 in the cities served by the WWTP.","Impact":"Incorrect estimation of the COVID-19 prevalence based on sewage monitoring could result in inaccurate public health decisions and interventions.","Mitigation":"Collaboration with epidemiologists and public health experts to validate the relationship between sewage monitoring data and clinical case data, and ongoing refinement of the estimation methodology.","Technologies":"Epidemiological modeling and data analysis.","People":"Epidemiologists, public health experts, and policymakers.","Owner":"Public health authorities and researchers."},{"Description":"Recovery efficiency of F-specific RNA phages in purification and concentration steps.","Impact":"Overestimation of the recovery efficiency of SARS-CoV-2 RNA, leading to inaccurate measurements of viral load in sewage samples.","Mitigation":"Regular calibration of recovery efficiency measurements and validation against other viral concentration methods.","Technologies":"Viral concentration assays and quality control measures.","People":"Researchers and WWTP operators.","Owner":"Researchers and WWTP operators."}]}
